intro: Cyclobalanus celebica, commonly known as the Celebes cyclobalan, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palm-like appearance, with a single stem and large, broad leaves. It produces showy, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
